definition: to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The impact that made this crater likely almost destroyed Mimas.
sentences.chinese: 陨石坑所产生的影响，几乎可以摧毁整个的土卫一。

sentences.english: First, an empty rocket hull slammed into the Cabeus crater.
sentences.chinese: 首先，一枚空火箭壳体撞入卡比欧斯陨石坑。

sentences.english: What isn't clear is the relation of the crater to the radial troughs.
sentences.chinese: 陨石坑与辐射状盆地有没有联系现在还不清楚。

sentences.english: These dunes on a crater floor have a frost of carbon dioxide ice.
sentences.chinese: 陨石坑洞底部的沙丘表面覆盖着一层二氧化碳霜冻。

sentences.english: We made a perfect landing beside a small crater in the Sea of Tranquillity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在静海的一个小陨石坑旁安全着陆。

sentences.english: The floor of Goat Paddock Crater is covered by sediments deposited since the Pleistocene Epoch.
sentences.chinese: 山羊围场陨石坑的地面覆盖着自更新世以来的沉积物。

sentences.english: The biggest crater on Phobos is called Stickney.
sentences.chinese: 福波斯卫星表面最大的陨石坑称为“斯蒂克尼”。

definition: Phobos (moon of Mars), aka Mars I
Titan (moon of Saturn), aka Saturn VI
Ganymede (moon of Jupiter), aka Jupiter III
asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter
variant of 岩層|岩层[yan2 ceng2]/rock strata
